titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Its Records, 1908-1993, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Brenda L. Haes

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Western Writers of America Records, 1908-1993
titlepage.author: Brenda L. Haes

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The collection contains organizational records of the Western Writers of America which supports authors of the western genre.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

did.physdesc: 10 boxes and 1 oversized box (12 linear feet)

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Western Writers of America was established as a professional writers' organization in 1953. It was to serve as a support network for published western writers and recognize their achievements with annual Spur Awards for excellence in writing. It continues to serve as a forum and audience for western genre writers through publication of a newsletter and quarterly journal, annual conventions, and writing workshops.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains organizational records dating from 1954 through 1993 including correspondence, convention records, financial material, publications information, member records, and printed material. It also includes photographs and copies of The Roundup. The bulk of the collection is correspondence and financial material. Some items were transferred to other locations including 33 books, 1,299 periodicals, and 206 photographs and 2 photograph scrapbooks.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The materials primarily utilize the original series given by the Western Writers of America. Series include, but are not limited to, Anthologies, Auction, Convention Planning and Records, Correspondence, Financial Material, Member Information, Membership, Printed Material, The Roundup, Saddleman Award, Spur Awards, and Western Writers of America Member files.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Western Writers of America Records, 1908-1993, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas
